description:
The best college basketball video games:

• NCAA Basketball series by EA Sports - This was the gold standard of college hoops games for years. It featured over 100 licensed teams, player likenesses, and arenas. The gameplay was solid and it had a deep dynasty/season mode. Unfortunately, the series was discontinued in 2013 due to legal issues.

• March Madness series - Developed by 2K Sports, this series was popular for a while. It also had licensed teams and players, and good gameplay. However, it never quite measured up to the NCAA Basketball games. It was discontinued around the same time.

• NBA 2K series - While focused mainly on the pros, the 2K games do feature college teams and rosters you can play with. It's one of the best options currently for college basketball gameplay and graphics.

• College Basketball Coach series - This is a management sim that lets you build a college basketball program and coach a team. It focuses more on the strategic and coaching aspect rather than actual gameplay. But it's a deep and immersive experience for fans of college hoops management.

• NBA Live series - Like 2K, the Live games feature college rosters and teams you can choose to play with. The gameplay and graphics are good but not quite on par with 2K in most reviews.

Unfortunately none of the current college basketball options are as deep or robust as the discontinued NCAA Basketball and March Madness series were in their prime. But NBA 2K and the College Basketball Coach games offer the best college hoops experiences currently available. Hopefully a true licensed college basketball game will make a comeback at some point!
